SEARCH

Class Environment

java.lang.Object
Environment
public class Environment extends Object
Represents the environment or maze grid where the pathfinding takes place.

The Environment class handles grid management and visualization using ANSI color codes.

  • Constructor Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • Environment

      public Environment(int[][] grid)
      Constructs an Environment with the given grid.
      Parameters:
      grid - 2D array representing the maze (0 for path, 1 for wall)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the grid is null, empty, or not rectangular

  • Method Details

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid(int x, int y)
      Checks if the specified position is within bounds and walkable.
      Parameters:
      x - X coordinate
      y - Y coordinate
      Returns:
      true if the position is within the grid and not a wall; false otherwise

    • getNeighbors

      public List<Node> getNeighbors(Node node)
      Retrieves valid neighbor nodes for a given node.
      Parameters:
      node - The node for which to get neighbors
      Returns:
      List of valid neighboring nodes

    • printGrid

      public void printGrid(Node current)
      Convenience method to print the grid using only the current node.
      Parameters:
      current - The current node being explored

    • printGrid

      public void printGrid(Node current, Set<Node> openSet, Set<Node> closedSet, List<Node> path)
      Prints the current state of the grid with visualization.
      Parameters:
      current - Current node being explored
      openSet - Set of nodes in the open set (optional)
      closedSet - Set of nodes in the closed set (optional)
      path - The current path (optional)

    • setAnimationEnabled

      public void setAnimationEnabled(boolean enabled)
      Enables or disables animation.
      Parameters:
      enabled - true to enable animation, false to disable
